column4: you should need to add a script to /etc/udev/rules.d with the line KERNEL=="null" MODE="0666"
or fix it if it is already there with 0600
do you have any udev links in /etc/rc2.d?

I found https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/udev/+bug/69516, which seems to have the same problem, which seems to stem from multiple links to udev on boot, they deleted the extra one and were getting the correct permissions on /dev/null
might be a better idea, good luck
for some reason, deleting that file seems weird no?
i don't even have that file
alright, well, I'm out of ideas
lol thx, i appreciate the help, gonna ask server folks
boo, not getting responses in #ubuntu-server
*shrugs*, you could always just add a chmod to rc.local, not exactly the nicest solution though
thats what i'm going to do for now, i just wanted to poke around here to see if i can find out why it happened
someone else was having the same problem the other day with a VPS, wonder if it is the same host
its VPSLink
do they have prebuilt images or do you install it yourself? you might want to contact your provider about it if they are prebuilt
they do and one of the things i recently changed was the path to the repos, it referenced a local VPSLink repository
i wonder if they tamper with packages, but everything else is perfect, except this.
that could be the case, i would email support about it
they don't have suppport and they'll tell me to change it back, i honestly don't want to cause theyremove a lot of packages i needed, like perlmagick
ahh

loads last I believe
